newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-ELBER AND BOBIC PROPEL STUTTGART TO CUP WIN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ELBER AND BOBIC PROPEL STUTTGART TO CUP WIN.

text.p: VfB Stuttgart's twin strike force of German international Fredi Bobic and Brazilian Giovane Elber put the Bundesliga leaders into the quarter-finals of the German Cup on Wednesday with a 2-0 win over second division Zwickau.
Despite Elber's goal shortly before the interval of the third round tie, Stuttgart never looked safe until Bobic struck in the 82nd minute.
Karlsruhe made easier work of their tie with Greuther Fuerth, conquerors of holders Kaiserslautern in the first round.
Sean Dundee, the Bundesliga's top scorer, netted one of Karlsruhe's goals in their 3-1 win.
The only upset of the day came when regional league side Energie Cottbus eliminated Bundesliga strugglers Duisburg on penalties.
Cottbus looked to have the tie wrapped up within normal time with a single second half goal but Duisburg hit an 88th-minute equaliser to take the game into extra time.
The east German side took the lead once more only for another Duisburg equaliser to take the match to penalties.
Cottbus keeper Kay Wehner held one Duisburg kick, which proved enough to give his side a 5-4 win on penalties.

"I could've done with a few headache tablets at the end," Cottbus coach Eduard Geyer said of the tense climax to the game. "We were definitely the better side but when the score got to 1-1, I thought we'd struggle."
